entry.et: Middle English, from Old English pott; akin to Middle Low German pot pot

def.dt: :a usually rounded metal or earthen container used chiefly for domestic purposes (as in cooking or for holding liquids or growing plants)
:any of various technical or industrial vessels or enclosures resembling or likened to a household pot the pot of a still
:an enclosed framework of wire, wood, or wicker for catching fish or lobsters
:the total of the bets at stake at one time
:a shot in snooker in which a ball is pocketed
:a vessel for urination and defecation: as
:to pack or preserve (as cooked and chopped meat) in a sealed pot, jar, or can often with aspic
:to make or shape (earthenware) as a potter
:to embed (as electronic components) in a container with an insulating or protective material (as plastic)

entry.et: perhaps modification of Mexican Spanish potiguaya

def.dt: :the residue of fermented wort left in a still after the distillation of whiskey or alcohol and used for animal feed

entry.et: French, literally, pot on the fire

def.dt: :a French boiled dinner of meat and vegetables
:having roots so densely matted as to allow little or no space for further growth
:a small cloth pad used for handling hot cooking utensils or containers
